page.title: 11Walsden Cricket Club.
page.content: When the team was first formed between 1870-1880 the team was called White Slack and played friendly matches. Later in 1892 the Central Lancashire League was formed, Walsden being a founder member. Originally the pavilion was by the Rochdale Rd. side, next to the river Calder. Then, in about 1912, an old church was purchased in Oldham and transported to Walsden by horse and cart. This was then formed into a new pavilion on Scott St. The bar and changing room extension was added in 1962. Walsden played in the league for 64 years before winning their first title. In 1964, when the professional was Everton Weekes, Walsden won the Wood Cup, the leagues knock-out competition. Since then they have won it in 1962 and 1975. (CONTINUED)
